text: Has anyone encountered a work around or something that I could use that is similar to the Contact Form 7 signature add-on for HubSpot forms? Ideally adding a signature field that someone can sign within a HubSpot form. <https://wordpress.org/plugins/contact-form-7-signature-addon/> I've pitched the idea of a checkbox line but...no bueno :disappointed:

interesting. I haven’t seen someone do it but theoretically there might be a signature javascript plugin that could take the signature and record it as SVG. and you could pass that code in as a value to say a text input.

Then if there’s a value to that input you know it was signed. and if someone ever needed to recall the signed value you could simply pull the code out and pop it into a text editor and voila the signature
<https://github.com/szimek/signature_pad> I found this, can't say how well it works
Maybe you could use this and pass it to a file upload or, as Jon said, a text input for the svg or data URL?
Never used this thing, so I can't vouch for it
Ah, very interesting - I'll give it a shot :slightly_smiling_face:

:thinking_face: Interesting Question for Y’all :thinking_face:
> :point_right::skin-tone-3:From a technical perspective, what is preventing developers from building open-source projects on top of HubSpot CMS? 

> :point_right::skin-tone-3:What could HubSpot do to make open-source projects easier? 

PLEASE comment - Very interested :smiley:

the short, snarky answer: the local developer experience. Open Source and Git are just about married at this point, if we're going to open source a template or module or something, we need a manageable way to develop locally, store our work in repos, and tie into a version control system that allows for collaboration (and ultimately import that asset into our portals). I guess there could be something HS could build, like a shared portal or something (coining the term now.... HubHub. or HubaHuba. GitSpot? working titles) that we could pull and commit etc from our in-browser portals, but I would think the better investment for HubSpot would be creating a way to easily and logically structure projects and tap into the structures already standard in the industry. Just my two cents.
Anyone have any forms break due to HubSpot updating the HTML markup of the form?
I thought it was something that we missed in QA but now I’m gonna check a couple other sites
